title: Lead Technical Solutions Engineer
content:
The Company
Media.Monks is a digital-first marketing, data, advertising and technology services company connecting the dots across content, data & digital media and technology services. Inspired by the connectivity and flexibility of technology APIs, Media.Monks’ single-P&L model offers brands seamless access to a nearly 9,000-strong team of digital talent organized across 57 talent hubs in 33 countries.
The Role’s Responsibilities
We’re hiring for a Lead Solutions Engineer. The scope of the role covers these categories:
Internal cloud and software engineering services
Client-facing cloud, data, and software engineering services, and
Broad technology support to our Account Management and fulfillment teams.
Connecting business requirements and domain knowledge with technology
In this role you will be leading a team of solutions engineers delivering technology solutions.  The role is for engineering leads who are true entrepreneurs and take on the role of engineer, consultant, and platform specialist.  
Excellent communication skills, along with the perseverance to solve problems that may not have obvious solutions. You may need to "Think out of the box" or "hack around" a problem to solve it. We like that!
You Will
Lead and mentor a team of talented engineers
Manage, direct, and prioritize projects
Maintain our technical relationship with our technology partners
Be aware of the latest cloud, data and software technology trends and look for opportunities for these trends to help grow our business
Provide training on core technology and services
Collaborate with leads in other regions to understand to keep a pulse on technical developments and provide resource capacity
Build innovative tools to address compelling commercial use cases that are valuable to our clients and that help grow our business 
Write technical documentation and provide training on the tools we build to other engineers and account managers across the globe
Provide solutions engineering services along the lines of data integration, platform migration, workflow and process automation and technical architecture consulting. 
Provide technical guidance on complex platform and implementation issues
Qualifications & Experience
Exceptional leadership, project management, analytical problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Current architecture and data engineering certifications for GCP (or being ready to pass these before joining the company)
Experience with Cloud based Data Engineering and ETL solutions
Working knowledge of relational and non-relational databases
Excellent Python and Node.js coding skills
Able to speak confidently about solutions to peers and other engineers
Ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical people
Ability to prioritize a number of projects and collaborate across technical teams of different disciplines.
Bonus Points
Experience deploying to AWS, Azure and other Cloud Platforms
Experience with terraform or similar “infrastructure as code” solutions
Familiarity with GMP, GA360 and Adobe cloud services
Knowledge of non-GMP site side product, tagging, analytics platforms (Adobe Analytics, Adobe Launch, Tealium, Segment Amplitude)
Previous sales, support, consulting, or biz dev experience
Technology Used
Node.js, JavaScript, Python
GitHub
Postman, Charles Proxy
Google Marketing Platform (GA, GTM, CM, DV360), 
Google Cloud Platform
Adobe Analytics Stack (Adobe Analytics, Launch and Target)
#LI-CX1
 About Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.
Disclaimer: 
Responsible for resourcing and implementing security controls for your teams processes and systems
Responsible that all your personnel apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy

questions.label: Will you now or in the future need visa sponsorship for the country in which you are applying?
What is your expected annual base salary?
